w:r.w:t: For Windows v1.0.1.18 and Android v1.0.1.18
Exposed by the HTML Document (Application → Game)
Extra game messages and how to setup on Windows/Android
. Altered the functions names to be those exposed by the app rather than those by the demo wrapper.
Added software version note on title page
Note that games are intended to run in portrait mode only.
The games must self-scale to fill the viewport provided.
The game will only appear on the menu screen if:
The web game runner is installed,
The caller is setup to run the game, and
The game’s buttons, splash screen and html files are installed.
The game is installed the same way as the other Wexel Android applications.
This will be already provisioned by Wexel.
The executable and DLL(s) need to be installed in …Blis\Tablet\WebGameWrapper
This will be already provisioned by Wexel.
The game files need to be in a subdirectory off the Game folder. The directory is the same name as issued by the caller.
The structure and files must be (at least):
– Large button to display on menu. 236x188 pixels
– Splash screen shown while game is loading. 500x375 pixels
– The HTML file which will be loaded.
Note that all png’s for the buttons and splash must be 32bit at 96dpi. Transparency is encouraged and supported.
Graphics may be rescaled and re
sampled by the software at runtime.
Anything else (with subdirectories) may reside in the html folder. Note that other folders on the t
ablet may not be accessible or e
No other files or folders may be places in the [
] folder as these may be deleted or overwritten other Wexel applications on the device.

The game has the option to save its settings (e.g. parameters for operation, percentage values) and its state (e.g. value of pots, prize amounts, prizes won) in the Blis database. Wexel need to be informed of any special requirements and initial values for these. The game may save its state at any time but the settings may only be changed by the Blis Caller software and not the game.
Once the application has detected the HTML document is fully loaded, it will
[OPTIONAL] Send the location for currency display -
the application has sent all of the above, it will set the game engine state to APPINITIALISED and will wait for the game to be ready.
Once the game is ready to play
it must change the engine state (via
The application will then, when ready, change the engine state to HIDING
Once the application is ready to show the HTML document, the game will be sent the engine state of
application has initialised the game and has been sent the engine state of IDLE, the game playing rounds can start

engine states are almost the same. It’s only from either of these two states that bets will be accepted by the application. The only difference (to the game) is perhaps it may want to show a win animation at
Betting may only be performed if the game engine state is at
To place a bet the game needs to call
The application will tell the game the engine state is
The game playing must not be allowed to start until the game receives a response via
On a valid bet, the application will tell the game the engine state is
An invalid bet will put the engine state back to
Note that although monies will seem to be deducted from the player, the banked money for that player’s position will not be affected until the game has finished playing.
The game must only play once the bet is accepted. Game playing may be interrupted by the controlling application at any time (error states, etc).
Once the game is deemed over, the game must call
The application will (eventually) inform the game of the new engine state:
– Game has to check before the win may be paid.
– OK to end the game and show the winnings to the player

The application will not (current version) need to perform any validation on the win. However, should the win not be able to be paid into the player’s bank the application will force the game to go into an error state.
The application will ‘ping’ the game periodically to check it’s still responsive. The game must respond and ping back or the game process may be terminated.
At any time the application may decide to terminate the game without any notice.
Should the application detect an error, it will attempt to inform the game via the
function. The application expects the game to deal with this appropriately.
The list of functions expected to be present in the HTML document, and which will be exposed in the application are as follow.

Function calls (to the app) will return immediately with any work being performed asynchronously with the result being fired back in later using the appropriate exposed javascript function in the html document.
Exposed by the HTML Document (Application → Game)
ist of functions the HTML document should expose to the application
ay be sent periodically by the containing
– integer value. Will be the balance in pence, cents, etc.

Each game must store its game state in the Blis caller database. Games which rely on third party servers for information will still get this from the caller (albeit a single byte) which they can ignore.
saved game state saved in the Blis database.
The game settings set by the caller.
Typically percentages and which stakes to play. Contents will depend on agreement with Wexel as what needs to be setup. A game may chose to ignore this but it will be sent nevertheless.
– byte array. This is the game settings set by the Blis caller.
More general settings sent by the Blis caller
. At the time or writing this is just the flag to state whether higher staked games such be presented to the user first.
– boolean: high stakes first. If true show the higher stake prize table and descend down on stake button presses.
After placing a bet, the game must wait until a response is made by the caller.
– boolean. Whether the bet was accepted or not
– string. On an invalid bet, this will be the reason for rejection. Human readable.
Receive the game status from the engine.
– string. The state the game engine is in. Will be one of:
– App has initialised and is awaiting the game
– Game should be idle and awaiting bets
– Game is in betting mode waiting bet confirmation
– Bet has been confirmed, game can play
– Game is in winning mode and awaiting confirmation (OPTIONAL)
The app must know if the game is still responsive or not. If no functions have been called by the app after a certain amount of time, the app will call this and expect a ping response from the game.
The game is sent the location so it can display currency and weight prizes/stakes correctly.
– string. Where the game is being played. Can be one of:
– Note, will be played for credits or tokens. Currently not used
Should the app try to process something from the game and fails, an error will be thrown back to the game to deal with.
– Something very bad has happened in the app. Inform Wexel
– Game has sent a request out of sequence and is ignoring it.
– Description of the error. For debugging purposes only, not generally human friendly.
List of functions the app exposes to the HTML document
. These will immediately return true/false on simple validation of the parameters passed in (not to be confu
sed with the response needed for
To call the exposed wrapper function from javascript you can access the ‘window’ object if running under Microsoft Windows or there will be an ‘Android’ object specially provided in Android versions.
Tell the caller to save our game state. Optional if no state needed (random games) or
use a third party server (although the caller WILL send the game a state at game startup).
– byte array. This is the saved game state saved in the Blis database.
Tell the app about a change in the games status. Note the app will generally ignore this (it decides on the status itself) apart from when it’s awaiting the reply
– App is starting up (game should not be awake in time to see this)
– App has initialised and is awaiting the game
– Game should be idle and awaiting bets
– Game is in betting mode waiting bet confirmation
– Bet has been confirmed, game can play
– Game is in winning mode and awaiting confirmation (OPTIONAL)
Ask the caller to make a bet
– integer. The pence (or cent, etc) value to bet
When the game is over, resend the stake and win (may be zero) to the caller
– integer. Amount staked in pence (or cents, etc).
– integer. Amount won in pence (or cents, etc). May be zero.
Respond to the caller when it requests a ping
The game may want the top bar (behind the menu and info bar) to change colour for aesthetic reasons.
Note that the game wrapper may use an alternate number in special circumstances.
– string. 6 character hex value in RRGGBB forma (Red, Green, Blue).
Store a message in the Blis caller database.
Any other value will be converted to a 4
– string. What to store in the database.

A sample application and basic game has been provided to test games outside of the Blis environment. By default it will expect the game to be in a “Game” subdirectory and the html file to be named “game.html”. Can be overridden with the optional command line options:
– set the game directory. This is where the initial html should be and where settings are saved to and loaded from.
– set the name of the html file to load
Should the game need any settings or game state, these should be in files “
” respectively in the same location as the initial html file. These can be in whichever format you require and will be sent to the game as binary arrays (see appropriate functions).
The sample application provides you with the following debug panel:
Adj. Balance is balance minus stake played. Stake is not removed from balance until game end.
Engine state is the state sent to the game.
SDK state is just used internally by the app and is for Wexel debugging purposes.
A new balance can be sent to the game.
Auto Resume will fire the “IDLE” state automatically into the game at startup.
Games are hidden until the app is ready – can override this by “Don’t Hide Game”.
Close tells the app to prepare to close – terminate closes the game immediately.
May consider changing some/all of the javascript calls to use JSON or something similar.
